item.title: ‘Disappointed but not surprised’: Former employees speak on OpenAI’s opposition to SB 1047
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Two former OpenAI researchers who resigned this year over safety concerns say they are disappointed but not surprised by OpenAI’s decision to oppose California’s bill to prevent AI disasters, SB 1047. Daniel Kokotajlo and William Saunders previously warned that OpenAI is in a “reckless” race for dominance. “Sam Altman, our former boss, has repeatedly called […]

item.title: Peloton adds $95 activation fee for used equipment
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
The move is an effort to squeeze additional revenue from second-hand products, over concerns that cheaper, slightly used bikes, treadmills and rowers could cannibalize used sales.

item.title: Meta and Spotify CEOs criticize AI regulation in the EU
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta and Spotify are once again teaming up — this time, on the matter of open source (or to be precise, open-weight) AI which the companies claim are being hampered by regulations. In joint statements published to both companies’ respective websites on Friday, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Spotify CEO Daniel Ek complain that EU […]

item.title: Tingit is building a marketplace for ‘zero-effort’ repairs, starting with fashion
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Tingit, a startup out of Lithuania, wants to help people restore their used clothing to their former glory with its newly launched repairs marketplace.

item.title: After changing its license, Redis drops its biggest release yet
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Redis, the company behind the popular in-memory data store, which is often used as a cache, vector database or streaming engine, today announced the launch of Redis 8. With this release, the company is doubling down on Redis as a vector database for AI use cases and launching an AI Copilot the help developers more […]

item.title: 360 One lifts its valuation of India’s National Stock Exchange to $29.9B
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
360 One Asset, an investor in National Stock Exchange (NSE), has increased its valuation for India's top stock exchange to $29.9 billion.

item.title: Get in on the ground floor with Tesla’s humanoid by pretending to be one for pay
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Tesla is hiring individuals standing between 5’7 and 5’11 to carry up to 30 pounds for seven hours a day to train its Optimus robot.

item.title: DeepMind workers sign letter in protest of Google’s defense contracts
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
At least 200 workers at DeepMind, Google’s AI R&D division, are displeased with Google’s reported defense contracts — and according to Time, they circulated a letter internally back in May to say as much. The letter, dated May 16, says the undersigned are concerned by “Google’s contracts with military organizations,” citing articles about the tech […]

item.title: NASA to decide Saturday whether astronauts will ride Boeing’s Starliner home — or use SpaceX’s Dragon instead
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
NASA officials will announce their final decision on Saturday as to whether two NASA astronauts — Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams — will return to Earth on Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft or hitch a ride home with SpaceX instead — a decision that could have a huge impact across the rapidly evolving space industry. Here’s the […]

item.title: Gimbal Space takes on legacy suppliers with fast-paced component supply chain
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
America’s space industry seems mature, but the supply chain that provides all the parts and components for rockets, satellites, and other spacecraft is considerably less so. Gimbal Space is aiming to change that, starting with components in the crucial subsystem that enables a spacecraft to orient itself in space — but delivered cheaper and a whole […]

item.title: Waymo wants to chauffeur your kids
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Soon, parents in range of Waymo robotaxis might not have to worry about picking up their kids from after-school activities — or any time, really. The San Francisco Standard reports that Waymo, the Alphabet subsidiary, is considering a subscription program that would let teens hail one of its cars solo and send pickup and drop-off […]

item.description:

But that’s not deterring Sankaet Pathak from forging full steam ahead with his new robotics venture. item.title: Cruise’s robotaxis are coming to the Uber app in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Cruise, General Motors’ self-driving subsidiary, said it has signed a multi-year partnership with ride-hailing giant Uber to bring its robotaxis to the ride-hailing platform in 2025.  Cruise didn’t say when exactly customers would see its vehicles on Uber’s platform, but a spokesperson told TechCrunch that this partnership will follow the re-launch of Cruise’s own driverless […]

item.title: Boston Dynamics’ new electric Atlas can do push-ups
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Until today, we’ve seen exactly 40 seconds of Boston Dynamics’ new electric Atlas in action. The Hyundai-owned robotics stalwart is very much still in the early stages of commercializing the biped for factory floors. For now, however, it’s doing the thing Boston Dynamics does second best after building robots: showing off in viral video form. […]

item.title: AI sales rep startups are booming. So why are VCs wary?
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
When you really probe venture capitalists about investing in AI startups, they’ll tell you that businesses are experimenting wildly but are very slow to add AI solutions into their ongoing business processes.  But there are some exceptions. And one of them appears to be an area known as AI sales development representatives, or AI SDRs. […]

Citing a crowded market and profit concerns, Mineral ceased operation and pivoted to technology licensing.
